name: hausdorffIntegrate_linear
context:
AVAILABLE LEMMAS:
- formVectorPairing_add: formVectorPairing (ω₁ + ω₂) τ x = formVectorPairing ω₁ τ x + formVectorPairing ω₂ τ x
- formVectorPairing_smul: formVectorPairing (c • ω) τ x = c * formVectorPairing ω τ x
- MeasureTheory.set_integral_add for ∫ in S, (f + g) = ∫ f + ∫ g
- MeasureTheory.set_integral_smul for scalar multiplication
- Complex.add_re, Complex.mul_re for real part decomposition

The definition is:
hausdorffIntegrate data ω = (∫ x in data.carrier, formVectorPairing ω data.orientation x ∂data.measure).re

Need to show: hausdorffIntegrate data (c • ω₁ + ω₂) = c.re * hausdorffIntegrate data ω₁ + hausdorffIntegrate data ω₂

name: hausdorffIntegrate_bound
context:
This is the mass-comass duality inequality.

KEY STEPS:
1. |∫ x, ⟨ω, τ⟩ dμ| ≤ ∫ x, |⟨ω, τ⟩| dμ (triangle inequality for integrals)
2. |⟨ω, τ⟩| ≤ comass(ω) when |τ| = 1 (definition of comass)
3. ∫ x, comass(ω) dμ = comass(ω) · μ(carrier) = comass(ω) · mass

Mathlib lemmas:
- MeasureTheory.norm_integral_le_integral_norm
- MeasureTheory.integral_mono for integral inequalities
- abs_re_le_abs for |z.re| ≤ |z|

name: integrate_linear_rectifiable
description: Prove integrate is linear for OrientedRectifiableSetData
context:
This uses hausdorffIntegrate_linear which is now available.
The goal is: hausdorffIntegrate data (c • ω₁ + ω₂) = c • hausdorffIntegrate data ω₁ + hausdorffIntegrate data ω₂

NOTE: The types might differ (ℂ vs ℝ scalars). Check exact goal.

name: stokes_bound_rectifiable
description: Prove Stokes bound for rectifiable sets
context:
Stokes theorem: ∫_Z dω = ∫_∂Z ω

For the bound: |∫_Z dω| ≤ bdryMass * comass(dω)

This follows from hausdorffIntegrate_bound applied to the boundary data.
The boundary has measure data.boundary_measure on data.boundary_carrier.

name: integrate_linear_closed
description: Prove integrate is linear for ClosedSubmanifoldData
context: Same as integrate_linear_rectifiable but using data.toOrientedData.

name: stokes_bound_closed
description: Prove Stokes bound for closed submanifolds
context:
For CLOSED submanifolds (no boundary), ∫_Z dω = 0 because ∂Z = ∅.
The bound |∫_Z dω| ≤ 0 * comass(dω) = 0 is trivially satisfied.

Key: bdryMass = 0 for closed submanifolds.
